title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Housing Loans Regulations
text_raw: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Housing Loans Regulations
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited housing loan regulation

title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: (2) These Regulations come into operation on 4 January 2022.
text_raw:
2021. 

(2) These Regulations come into operation on 4 January 2022. 

Definitions

title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations—
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations— 

“Act of 1992” means Housing (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 1992 (No. 18 of 
1992); 

“Act of 2009” means Housing (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2009 (No. 22 of 
2009); 

“Act of 2014” means Housing (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2014 (No. 21 of 
2014); 

“Act of 2021” means Affordable Housing Act 2021 (No. 25 of 2021); 

“applicant” means a person who applies for a housing loan on his or her own or 
2 or more persons who apply for a housing loan together; 

“Credit Policy Guidelines” means Housing Loans (Credit Policy) Guidelines 
2021 made under section 5 of the Act of 2009; 

“dwelling” has the meaning assigned to it by section 4 of the Act of 2021; 

“housing loan” means the amounts advanced by a housing authority, or the total 
sum of amounts advanced by a housing authority, to a borrower which are or are 
to be secured by way of a legal charge on a property; 

“market value” in relation to a dwelling, means the price for which the dwelling 
might reasonably be expected to be sold on the open market for the estate 
purchased by the applicant, freed and discharged of any mortgage or, as 
determined by the housing authority concerned; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 24th December, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [701] 3 

“purchase price” in relation to a dwelling, means the price of the dwelling 
determined by the housing authority making a housing loan in respect of it; 

“value” means— 

(a) 

(b) 

in the case of an existing or new dwelling, the market value of the 
dwelling, or 

in the case of a dwelling being constructed, the amount, which in 
the opinion of the housing authority represents the reasonable cost 
(including all reasonable incidental expenses) of building the 
dwelling and the value of the interest of the borrower in the site 
thereof, and “valuation” shall be construed accordingly. 

Application
text_norm: 2 (1) regulations-- act 1992 mean housing (miscellaneous provisions) act 1992 (no 18 1992) act 2009 mean housing (miscellaneous provisions) act 2009 (no 22 2009) act 2014 mean housing (miscellaneous provisions) act 2014 (no 21 2014) act 2021 mean affordable housing act 2021 (no 25 2021) applicant mean person applies housing loan 2 person apply housing loan together credit policy guideline mean housing loan (credit policy) guideline 2021 made section 5 act 2009 dwelling meaning assigned section 4 act 2021 housing loan mean amount advanced housing authority total sum amount advanced housing authority borrower secured way legal charge property market value relation dwelling mean price dwelling might reasonably expected sold open market estate purchased applicant freed discharged mortgage determined housing authority concerned notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 24th december 2021 701 3 purchase price relation dwelling mean price dwelling determined housing authority making housing loan respect value means-- (a) (b) case existing new dwelling market value dwelling case dwelling constructed amount opinion housing authority represents reasonable cost (including reasonable incidental expenses) building dwelling value interest borrower site thereof valuation shall construed accordingly application

title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 3. These Regulations apply to the making of housing loans by housing
text_raw:
3. These Regulations apply to the making of housing loans by housing 
authorities, in accordance with Credit Policy Guidelines, to applicants for the 
purchase or construction of dwellings occupied or to be occupied by the 
applicants. 

Limitations as to dwellings
text_norm: 3 regulation apply making housing loan housing authority accordance credit policy guideline applicant purchase construction dwelling occupied occupied applicant limitation dwelling

title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 4. A housing authority may make a housing loan only in respect of a
text_raw:
4. A housing authority may make a housing loan only in respect of a 
dwelling within the State, the market value of which does not exceed, where the 
dwelling is situated — 

(a) 

in the county of Cork, Dublin, Galway, Kildare, Louth, Meath or 
Wicklow, €320,000, or 

(b) 

in any other county, €250,000, 

other than — 

(i) 

(ii) 

(iii) 

(iv) 

(v) 

the purchase of a dwelling under section 90 of the Housing 
Act 1966 (No. 21 of 1966), 

the sale of a dwelling to an eligible household under Part 3 
of the Act of 2009, 

the purchase of an apartment by a tenant under Part 4 of the 
Act of 2009, 

the sale of a house to a tenant under Part 3 of the Act of 
2014, or 

the purchase of a dwelling under an affordable dwelling 
purchase arrangement under Part 2 of the Act of 2021, 

where purchased for an amount lower than, where the dwelling is situated – 

(I) 

in the county of Cork, Dublin, Galway, Kildare, 
Louth, Meath or Wicklow, €320,000, or 

(II) 

in any other county, €250,000. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [701] 

Applications for housing loans
text_norm: 4 housing authority may make housing loan respect dwelling within state market value exceed dwelling situated -- (a) county cork dublin galway kildare louth meath wicklow eur320 000 (b) county eur250 000 -- (i) (ii) (iii) (iv) (v) purchase dwelling section 90 housing act 1966 (no 21 1966) sale dwelling eligible household part 3 act 2009 purchase apartment tenant part 4 act 2009 sale house tenant part 3 act 2014 purchase dwelling affordable dwelling purchase arrangement part 2 act 2021 purchased amount lower dwelling situated - (i) county cork dublin galway kildare louth meath wicklow eur320 000 (ii) county eur250 000 4 701 application housing loan

title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 5. (1) An application for a housing loan shall be made in such manner and
text_raw:
5. (1) An application for a housing loan shall be made in such manner and 

form as the housing authority may require. 

(2) Where a person who wishes to apply for a housing loan is — 

(a) married, 

(b) 

in a civil partnership, or 

(c) 

in an intimate and committed relationship with a partner with 
whom he or she intends to reside in the dwelling he or she wishes 
to purchase, 

he or she may not apply to a housing authority for a housing loan on his or her 
own but shall make any such application together with his or her spouse, civil 
partner or partner, as the case may be. 

Amount of loans
text_norm: 5 (1) application housing loan shall made manner form housing authority may require (2) person wish apply housing loan -- (a) married (b) civil partnership (c) intimate committed relationship partner intends reside dwelling wish purchase may apply housing authority housing loan shall make application together spouse civil partner partner case may be amount loan

title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 6. The amount of a housing loan shall not exceed—
text_raw:
6. The amount of a housing loan shall not exceed— 

(a) where the dwelling is situated — 

(i) 

in the county of Cork, Dublin, Galway, Kildare, Louth, 
Meath or Wicklow, €288,000, or 

(ii) 

in any other county, €225,000, and 

(b) where the purchase price of the dwelling — 

(i) 

is not set by a housing authority, 90 per cent of the value of 
the dwelling, or 

(ii) 

is set or agreed by a housing authority — 

(I) 

90 per cent of the purchase price of the dwelling, or 

(II) 

in respect of the sale of a house under section 25(1) 
of the Act of 2014 which is the subject of a direction 
given to a housing authority under section 24(3) of 
the Act of 2014 regarding the reckonable income of 
the tenant purchasing the house, 100 per cent of the 
price that the house is sold, 

whichever is the lesser. 

Eligibility criteria
text_norm: 6 amount housing loan shall exceed-- (a) dwelling situated -- (i) county cork dublin galway kildare louth meath wicklow eur288 000 (ii) county eur225 000 (b) purchase price dwelling -- (i) set housing authority 90 per cent value dwelling (ii) set agreed housing authority -- (i) 90 per cent purchase price dwelling (ii) respect sale house section 25(1) act 2014 subject direction given housing authority section 24(3) act 2014 regarding reckonable income tenant purchasing house 100 per cent price house sold whichever lesser eligibility criterion

title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 7. (1) An applicant shall only be eligible for a housing loan if—
text_raw:
7. (1) An applicant shall only be eligible for a housing loan if— 

(a) 

the combined gross income of all of the persons making the 
application, determined in accordance with Credit Policy 
Guidelines, does not exceed- 

(i) where the applicant is one person and the dwelling is 
situated in the county of Cork, Dublin, Galway, Kildare, 
Louth, Meath or Wicklow, €65,000 per annum, 

 
 
 
 [701] 5 

(ii) where the applicant is one person and the dwelling is 
situated in any county other than Cork, Dublin, Galway, 
Kildare, Louth, Meath or Wicklow, €50,000 per annum, or 

(iii) 

 where the applicant is two or more persons, €75,000 per 
annum; 

subject to paragraphs (3), (4) and (5) none of the persons making 
the application has previously purchased or built a dwelling in the 
State for his or her occupation; 

each of the persons making the application has a right to reside in 
the State; 

each of the persons making the application is 18 years of age or 
older and not older than 70 years of age; 

the dwelling being purchased will be the normal place of 
residence of each of the persons making the application; 

each of the persons making the application is not a borrower in 
receipt of any other housing loan made to them under section 11 
of the Act of 1992. 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

(2) Where— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

any of the persons making an application previously purchased or 
built a dwelling in the State, for his or her occupation, together 
with a spouse, a civil partner or a person with whom he or she 
was in an intimate and committed relationship, 

the marriage, civil partnership or relationship concerned has 
ended, and 

the person is now applying to purchase a dwelling on his or her 
own or with a different person, 

the previous purchase or building of the dwelling concerned shall not render the 
applicant ineligible for a housing loan. 

(3) For the purposes of paragraph (2) a marriage is deemed to have ended 
when it is the subject of a decree of judicial separation, divorce or nullity and a 
civil partnership is deemed to have ended when it is the subject of a decree of 
dissolution or nullity. 

(4) Where any of the persons making an application previously purchased or 
built a dwelling in the State for his or her occupation but that person 
demonstrates to the satisfaction of the housing authority assessing the eligibility 
of the applicant that he or she has sold, or has been divested of, that dwelling as 
part of a personal insolvency or bankruptcy arrangement or proceedings or other 
legal process consequent upon insolvency, then the previous purchase or 
building of the dwelling concerned shall not render the applicant ineligible for a 
housing loan. 

 
 
 
 
 6 [701] 

Repayment period
text_norm: 7 (1) applicant shall eligible housing loan if-- (a) combined gross income person making application determined accordance credit policy guideline exceed- (i) applicant one person dwelling situated county cork dublin galway kildare louth meath wicklow eur65 000 per annum 701 5 (ii) applicant one person dwelling situated county cork dublin galway kildare louth meath wicklow eur50 000 per annum (iii) applicant two person eur75 000 per annum subject paragraph (3) (4) (5) none person making application previously purchased built dwelling state occupation person making application right reside state person making application 18 year age older older 70 year age dwelling purchased normal place residence person making application person making application borrower receipt housing loan made section 11 act 1992 (b) (c) (d) (e) (f) (2) where-- (a) (b) (c) person making application previously purchased built dwelling state occupation together spouse civil partner person intimate committed relationship marriage civil partnership relationship concerned ended person applying purchase dwelling different person previous purchase building dwelling concerned shall render applicant ineligible housing loan (3) purpose paragraph (2) marriage deemed ended subject decree judicial separation divorce nullity civil partnership deemed ended subject decree dissolution nullity (4) person making application previously purchased built dwelling state occupation person demonstrates satisfaction housing authority assessing eligibility applicant sold divested dwelling part personal insolvency bankruptcy arrangement proceeding legal process consequent upon insolvency previous purchase building dwelling concerned shall render applicant ineligible housing loan 6 701 repayment period

title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 8. Unless otherwise agreed by the housing authority, a housing loan shall
text_raw:
8. Unless otherwise agreed by the housing authority, a housing loan shall 
be repaid within such period not exceeding 30 years from the date of the making 
of the housing loan or, in the case of housing loans for the construction of new 
dwelling where the housing loan is made by instalments, from such date not later 
than the date of the payment of the final instalment as may be determined by the 
housing authority making the loan. 

Manner of repayment
text_norm: 8 unless otherwise agreed housing authority housing loan shall repaid within period exceeding 30 year date making housing loan case housing loan construction new dwelling housing loan made instalment date later date payment final instalment may determined housing authority making loan manner repayment

title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 9. Housing loans shall be repaid by an annuity of principal and interest
text_raw:
9. Housing loans shall be repaid by an annuity of principal and interest 

combined and all payments shall be made at monthly intervals. 

Interest rates
text_norm: 9 housing loan shall repaid annuity principal interest combined payment shall made monthly interval interest rate

title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 10. The rate of interest on a housing loan shall be such rate as may be fixed
text_raw:
10. The rate of interest on a housing loan shall be such rate as may be fixed 
from time to time by the Minister, provided that the rate shall not be less than 
the rate at which money is lent to housing authorities by the Housing Finance 
Agency for the purpose of making such housing loans. 

Duties of borrowers
text_norm: 10 rate interest housing loan shall rate may fixed time time minister provided rate shall le rate money lent housing authority housing finance agency purpose making housing loan duty borrower

title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 11. (1) A dwelling in respect of which a housing loan has been advanced,
text_raw:
11. (1) A dwelling in respect of which a housing loan has been advanced, 
until the loan with interest thereon is fully paid, or until the housing authority 
shall have recovered possession of the dwelling in accordance with section 11(5) 
of the Act of 1992, shall be held subject to the following conditions— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

every sum for the time being due in respect of principal or interest 
shall be punctually paid, 

the borrower shall use the dwelling as his or her normal place of 
residence, and 

the borrower shall keep the dwelling adequately insured to the 
satisfaction of the housing authority. 

(2) The insurance of a dwelling in respect of which a housing loan is made 
shall be effected by the borrower, and a receipt for the payment of each premium 
in respect of such insurance shall be produced by the borrower to the housing 
authority concerned on request by them. 

(3) Any addition to an instalment or other periodical payment, payable under 
subparagraph (a) of paragraph (1), shall not be included in the amount of a 
housing loan secured in accordance with these Regulations. 

Liabilities of borrowers
text_norm: 11 (1) dwelling respect housing loan advanced loan interest thereon fully paid housing authority shall recovered possession dwelling accordance section 11(5) act 1992 shall held subject following conditions-- (a) (b) (c) every sum time due respect principal interest shall punctually paid borrower shall use dwelling normal place residence borrower shall keep dwelling adequately insured satisfaction housing authority (2) insurance dwelling respect housing loan made shall effected borrower receipt payment premium respect insurance shall produced borrower housing authority concerned request them (3) addition instalment periodical payment payable subparagraph (a) paragraph (1) shall included amount housing loan secured accordance regulation liability borrower

title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 12. A borrower shall be personally liable for the repayment of any sum due
text_raw:
12. A borrower shall be personally liable for the repayment of any sum due 

in respect of a housing loan made in accordance with these Regulations. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [701] 7 

Revocation
text_norm: 12 borrower shall personally liable repayment sum due respect housing loan made accordance regulation 701 7 revocation

title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 13. The Housing (Rebuilding Ireland Home Loans) Regulations 2018 (S.I.
text_raw:
13. The Housing (Rebuilding Ireland Home Loans) Regulations 2018 (S.I. 

No. 25 of 2018) are revoked. 

Saver
text_norm: 13 housing (rebuilding ireland home loans) regulation 2018 (s.i no 25 2018) revoked saver

title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: 14. Notwithstanding the revocation under Regulation 13 of the Housing
text_raw:
14. Notwithstanding the revocation under Regulation 13 of the Housing 
(Rebuilding Ireland Home Loans) Regulations 2018 (S.I. No. 25 of 2018), those 
Regulations continue to apply to— 

(a) 

(b) 

a housing loan made by a housing authority, or 

an application made to a housing authority for a housing loan, but 
the application has not been considered or the loan has not been 
made by the housing authority, 

in accordance with the revoked Regulations before the commencement of these 
Regulations. 

 
 
 
 
 8 [701] 

The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the making of the 
foregoing Regulations. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Public 
Expenditure and Reform, 
14 December, 2021. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

14 December, 2021. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [701] 9

title: Order 2011 (S.I. No. 418 of 2011)) with the consent of the Minister for Public
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations, which come into operation on 4 January 2022 provide for 
the provision of loan finance by local authorities to eligible first time buyers 
for the acquisition of new or existing houses, or for the construction of houses. 

 
 
 
 
 
 10 [701]
